1.title: Vision of God’s Glory
1.keyEvent: Ezekiel sees the divine chariot and glory

2.title: Commissioning of Ezekiel
2.keyEvent: God calls Ezekiel to be a prophet to Israel

3.title: Eating the Scroll
3.keyEvent: Ezekiel consumes God’s message and is sent to Israel

4.title: Siege of Jerusalem
4.keyEvent: Ezekiel enacts Jerusalem’s siege as a sign

5.title: Judgment on Jerusalem
5.keyEvent: Prophecy of Jerusalem’s punishment for rebellion

6.title: Judgment on Mountains
6.keyEvent: God condemns idolatry in the mountains of Israel

7.title: End of Judgment
7.keyEvent: Announcement of the imminent end and disaster

8.title: Idolatry in the Temple
8.keyEvent: Vision of abominations in the Jerusalem temple

9.title: Marking the Faithful
9.keyEvent: God commands marking of the righteous in Jerusalem

10.title: Glory Departs Temple
10.keyEvent: Vision of God’s glory leaving the temple

12.title: Exile Symbolized
12.keyEvent: Ezekiel acts out exile and captivity

13.title: Condemnation of False Prophets
13.keyEvent: God denounces lying prophets misleading Israel

14.title: Idolatrous Elders
14.keyEvent: God warns elders who set up idols

15.title: Useless Vinewood
15.keyEvent: Israel compared to worthless vinewood for fire

16.title: Jerusalem’s Unfaithfulness
16.keyEvent: Allegory of Jerusalem’s harlotry and punishment

17.title: Parable of Two Eagles
17.keyEvent: Prophecy against Judah’s kings and exile

18.title: Individual Responsibility
18.keyEvent: God teaches personal accountability for sin

19.title: Lament for Princes
19.keyEvent: Dirge for fallen leaders of Judah

20.title: Rebellion History
20.keyEvent: Recap of Israel’s rebellious history and judgment

21.title: Sword of the Lord
21.keyEvent: Prophecy of coming sword and judgment on Jerusalem

22.title: Judgment on Jerusalem’s Sins
22.keyEvent: List of Jerusalem’s crimes and coming punishment

23.title: Two Sisters Allegory
23.keyEvent: Symbolic judgment on Samaria and Jerusalem’s unfaithfulness

24.title: Cooking Pot Parable
24.keyEvent: Ezekiel’s wife dies as sign of Jerusalem’s fall

25.title: Judgment on Ammon
25.keyEvent: Prophecy against Ammon for rejoicing over Judah

26.title: Tyre’s Destruction
26.keyEvent: Prophecy of Tyre’s downfall by many nations

27.title: Lament for Tyre
27.keyEvent: Poetic lament describing Tyre’s wealth and ruin

28.title: Judgment on Sidon and King of Tyre
28.keyEvent: Condemnation of Sidon and prideful Tyre’s king

29.title: Egypt’s Captivity
29.keyEvent: Prophecy of Egypt’s exile for forty years

30.title: Egypt’s Doom
30.keyEvent: Further judgment against Egypt and its allies

31.title: Assyria Compared to Cedar
31.keyEvent: Assyria’s pride and fall likened to a cedar tree

32.title: Lament for Egypt
32.keyEvent: Egypt’s downfall described in a funeral lament

33.title: Watchman’s Duty
33.keyEvent: Ezekiel’s responsibility to warn the wicked

35.title: Judgment on Edom
35.keyEvent: Prophecy against Edom for hostility to Israel

36.title: Restoration Promised
36.keyEvent: God promises Israel’s renewal and blessing

37.title: Valley of Dry Bones
37.keyEvent: Vision of Israel’s resurrection and restoration

38.title: Gog’s Invasion
38.keyEvent: Prophecy of Gog’s attack on Israel

39.title: Defeat of Gog
39.keyEvent: God’s judgment destroys Gog and his armies

41.title: Temple Interior
41.keyEvent: Description of the temple’s inner sanctuary

42.title: Priests’ Chambers
42.keyEvent: Details of chambers for priests and temple servants

43.title: Glory Returns
43.keyEvent: God’s glory returns to the new temple

44.title: Temple Regulations
44.keyEvent: Rules for priests and temple worship established

45.title: Land Division
45.keyEvent: Instructions for dividing land among tribes

46.title: Prince’s Offerings
46.keyEvent: Regulations for prince’s worship and offerings

47.title: River from Temple
47.keyEvent: Vision of life-giving water flowing from temple

48.title: Tribal Allotments
48.keyEvent: Final division of land among Israel’s tribes
